examples: After reading her biography, I saw her accomplishments in a different light and gained a deeper admiration for her resilience and determination.
What is your greatest accomplishment?
What's your greatest accomplishment?
I like the sense of accomplishment.
You've got to celebrate the small accomplishments.
words.defineEn: a desired and impressive goal achieved through hard work
words.defineVi: một mục tiêu mong muốn và ấn tượng đạt được thông qua làm việc chăm chỉ

examples: A major technological advancement like that is still light years away.
Asian countries like China, Japan, and South Korea are known for their advancements in technology.
We discuss current scientific advancements and discoveries in science class.
We're still light years away from a technological advancement like that.
He didn't mind breaking a few rules to get ahead, believing that all is fair in love and war when it comes to career advancement.
words.defineEn: the process of improvement or progress
words.defineVi: quá trình cải thiện hoặc tiến bộ

examples: Although they struggled to make ends meet, the Johnsons took pride in their children's academic achievements and aspirations.
The college's aim is to help students achieve their aspirations.
For some people, a high-paying job is the be-all and end-all of their career aspirations.
They have humungous aspirations.
That puff of air is called aspiration.
words.defineEn: a strong will to achieve something
words.defineVi: một ý chí mạnh mẽ để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: His business was booming for a while, orders flooding in constantly.
"The economy is booming right now, but we have to be prepared for when things slow down because what goes up must come down," cautioned the economist.
Boom, that thing hits.
Boom, that thing hits.
Boom, done a dynamic boost.
words.defineEn: a time of great economic growth
words.defineVi: thời kỳ tăng trưởng kinh tế lớn

examples: Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
You're just chasing your tail at this point, but you might have a breakthrough with the research if you take a break from it.
By this time next year, they will still be living on borrowed time unless a breakthrough is made in medical research.
The scientist's experiments failed many times before she finally achieved her breakthrough, but she kept trying with the belief that if at first you do not succeed, try, try again.
Two of these people will make a breakthrough.
words.defineEn: an important discovery or development that helps improve a situation or answer a problem
words.defineVi: một khám phá hoặc phát triển quan trọng giúp cải thiện tình hình hoặc giải đáp một vấn đề

examples: The author was able to make a comeback after a series of poorly received books, with a new novel that became a bestseller and earned critical praise.
Despite being out of the public eye for several years, the singer made a comeback with a new album that received critical acclaim and commercial success.
We may be down by 10 points, but never say die - there's still time left in the game to make a comeback.
Those giant teeth just might make a comeback.
Seoul nightlife is also making a comeback.
words.defineEn: a return by a renowned person to their former popular or successful state
words.defineVi: sự trở lại của một người nổi tiếng với trạng thái nổi tiếng hoặc thành công trước đây của họ

examples: The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory.
The completion of the landmark building was the architect's crowning glory, showcasing their visionary design and construction skills.
Her latest novel is her crowning glory, receiving widespread critical acclaim and topping the bestseller lists.
John was nervous about quitting his stable job to start his own business, but he knew that no guts, no glory, and he took the leap.
The grand finale of the performance is the crowning glory of the entire show, leaving the audience in awe.
words.defineEn: the popularity, honor, and praise that a person receives as a result of a great success or act
words.defineVi: sự nổi tiếng, danh dự và lời khen ngợi mà một người nhận được do thành công hoặc hành động tuyệt vời

examples: She finally found a place in the sun with the triumph of her latest book.
After a long day of hiking, reaching the mountaintop felt like a triumph and a well-deserved destination.
You have triumphed.
The American president, George H.W. Bush, declared it a triumph.
I am Triumph, oh scary nerd.
words.defineEn: a great victory, success, or achievement gained through struggle
words.defineVi: một chiến thắng vĩ đại, thành công, hoặc thành tựu đạt được thông qua đấu tranh

examples: I put a lot of pressure on my kids to be high achievers.
words.defineEn: someone who reaches a high level of success, particularly in their occupation
words.defineVi: một người đạt đến một mức độ cao của thành công, đặc biệt là trong nghề nghiệp của họ

words.defineEn: the highest and most successful level in a profession, particularly in entertainment field
words.defineVi: mức cao nhất và thành công nhất trong một nghề nghiệp, đặc biệt là trong lĩnh vực giải trí

examples: They topped fruit tarts with mango coulis.
The fish tacos were topped with tangy slaw and creamy sauce.
This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
We topped our baked potatoes with a generous drizzle of bechamel sauce.
Write your name at the top of the paper.
words.defineEn: to be in the lead on a list, in a league, etc. because of being better than others
words.defineVi: dẫn đầu trong một danh sách, trong một giải đấu, v.v. vì giỏi hơn những người khác

examples: Since that merger, Costco has attained explosive growth.
But once they became isolated on these Mediterranean islands, some of these little critters attained massive body sizes.
It is about attaining something that is valued by others.
It is a very ambitious goal, if you can attain it.
The problem of diffusion and surface and energy production remained, limiting the size these first multicellular forms of life could attain.
words.defineEn: to succeed in reaching a goal, after hard work
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc đạt được một mục tiêu, sau khi làm việc chăm chỉ

examples: I enjoyed the sweet scent of blossoms on the flowering tree.
The scent of wild cherry blossoms filled the air, signaling the arrival of spring.
Japan is a country in Asia famous for its technology, anime, and cherry blossoms.
Beauty is but a blossom to those who don't know how to appreciate it.'
They watched as the bees buzzed around, sipping the nectar from the colorful blossoms.
words.defineEn: to start to be healthier, more successful, or confident
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu khỏe mạnh hơn, thành công hơn, hoặc tự tin

examples: She congratulated herself still more on observing in the course of days that Mr Verloc seemed to be taking kindly to Stevie's companionship.
Even though she lost the game, she remained a good sport and congratulated the winner.
She glanced at the phone and congratulated herself for having the spine not to return Carter’s calls.
She has arrived like a knight in shining armor at the eleventh hour, and she should be congratulated for that.
I congratulate you.
words.defineEn: to express one's good wishes or praise to someone when something very good has happened to them
words.defineVi: để bày tỏ lời chúc tốt đẹp hoặc lời khen ngợi cho ai đó khi điều gì đó rất tốt đã xảy ra với họ

examples: The entire health system was consolidating.
The bread business has to consolidate Sara Lee and Wonderbread, two of the biggest names in bread.
He was consolidating power.
In 2018, roughly 100 lawsuits over AFFF were consolidated in South Carolina.
William consolidated his gains with a huge castle-building campaign and a reorganization of English society.
words.defineEn: to strengthen a position of power or success so that it lasts longer
words.defineVi: để củng cố một vị trí quyền lực hoặc thành công để nó tồn tại lâu hơn

examples: The grape vine in my backyard is flourishing, with clusters of ripe grapes ready for harvest.
Her professional life flourished.
High culture also flourished.
Life was flourishing.
The sciences flourished and advanced transportation, communication, and medicine.
words.defineEn: to quickly grow in a successful way
words.defineVi: để nhanh chóng phát triển một cách thành công

words.defineEn: to be experiencing great success
words.defineVi: để được trải nghiệm thành công lớn

examples: John finally paid off his credit card debt and felt a huge weight lifted off his shoulders.
The student worked multiple jobs to pay off her student loans, acknowledging that debt is the worst poverty.

We've had to dig into our saving to pay off the debt.
After paying off my credit card, I am in credit by $500.

words.defineVi: (của một kế hoạch hoặc hành động) để thành công và có kết quả tốt

examples: Let's hope that common sense prevails and they find a happy medium.

Justice prevailed.
Democratic forces have prevailed.
And at this hour, my friends, democracy has prevailed.
words.defineEn: (of an opinion, idea, etc.) to prove superior and be accepted by others, particularly after a dispute or struggle
words.defineVi: (về một ý kiến, ý tưởng, v.v.) để chứng tỏ mình vượt trội và được người khác chấp nhận, đặc biệt là sau một cuộc tranh chấp hoặc đấu tranh

examples: The CEO of the company was fired after it was discovered that they had been embezzling funds - a harsh lesson that ill-gotten gains never prosper.
They could prosper.
And cheaters don’t prosper.

The year is 15 CE and the Roman Empire is prospering.
words.defineEn: to grow in a successful way, especially financially
words.defineVi: để phát triển một cách thành công, đặc biệt là tài chính

examples: Cogs in a machine can't strive for excellence.
When Tom's company was struggling to keep up with new competitors, Tom reminded his colleagues that it is ill striving against the stream.
As a teacher, I believe that the sun loses nothing by shining into a puddle, and I strive to give my students the tools and resources they need to succeed.
Instead of hiring the brightest scientists and locking them in an ivory tower with like-minded people, the organization strives to embrace collaboration and a full-stack scope of solutions.
Sarah was always striving for more success and recognition at work, but she found herself constantly stressed and anxious.
words.defineEn: to try as hard as possible to achieve a goal
words.defineVi: để cố gắng hết sức có thể để đạt được một mục tiêu

examples: A variety of plants and wildlife thrive on the lush riverbank.
If the head and feet keep warm, the rest will take no harm, and our overall health and well-being will thrive.

I believe that living at college gives you the best of both worlds: a place where both study and social life can thrive.
words.defineEn: to develop or grow well or continue to be successful
words.defineVi: để phát triển hoặc phát triển tốt hoặc tiếp tục thành công

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.

A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: a strong desire and determination to succeed
words.defineVi: một mong muốn mạnh mẽ và quyết tâm để thành công

examples: The student used an unconventional study method to memorize their notes, recognizing that it does not matter if a cat is black or white as long as it catches mice and prioritizing effectiveness over traditional approaches.

The effectiveness of this interference from Russia depends on a couple of things.

words.defineEn: the quality of yielding the desired result
words.defineVi: chất lượng mang lại kết quả mong muốn

examples: The athlete has become a poster boy for hard work and perseverance, inspiring young people around the world to pursue their dreams.

Despite initial setbacks, Susan's dedication and perseverance allowed things to fall into place, leading her to achieve her fitness goals.

As a parent, I teach my children the importance of perseverance and resilience, knowing that even the most successful individuals can face obstacles, for it is a good horse that never stumbles and a good wife that never grumbles.
words.defineEn: the quality of persistently trying in spite of difficulties
words.defineVi: phẩm chất kiên trì cố gắng dù khó khăn

examples: Both projects are kept on ice until the question of funding is resolved.

words.defineVi: một ý chí mạnh mẽ để có hoặc làm một cái gì đó có giá trị

examples: Now this posture may look desirable.

words.defineEn: worth doing or having

words.defineEn: deserving admiration, respect, and being very successful

examples: And even though it's not like a huge change or anything, but its- you can just take the time to make those individual videos a lot better, put a lot more energy into them, just feel more fulfilled with what you're uploading.

words.defineVi: được coi là thành công nhất hoặc quan trọng nhất, đặc biệt so với những người khác

examples: My grandfather often said that idleness is the root of evil, urging me to find meaningful work and stay productive.

Controlling your train of thoughts not only makes you more productive and effective in your work, it has other, more important benefits as well.

words.defineVi: tạo ra thứ gì đó có giá trị thông qua việc sử dụng hiệu quả và hiệu quả thời gian, nguồn lực và nỗ lực
